intro: Amyris sumatrana, commonly known as the Sumatran amyris, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia, particularly Indonesia. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, narrow leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces a fragrant resin that has been historically used in traditional medicine and as a perfume ingredient. Amyris sumatrana typically grows in tropical rainforests and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and commercial contexts.
